title: Textile, 1740–49
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: Discontinuous supplementary weft (brocade) on a plain weave foundation with auxiliary pattern created by weft floats.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 149 x 50 cm (58 11/16 x 19 11/16 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 124 x 50 cm (48 13/16 x 19 11/16 in.)
Repeat H: 56 cm (22 1/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Sprays of polychrome flowers and bowknots on a while background. Background is patterned with a white on white design. Both the primary and auxiliary pattern reverse in direction.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1740–49.
1740–49. Medium: silk
Technique: Discontinuous supplementary weft (brocade) on a plain weave foundation with auxiliary pattern created by weft floats.. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 1988-15-1-a,b.
